attributes.gcd: Refers to the unique identifier of the account or contract held by the customer. Account number is defined as numbers, letters or alphanumeric code assigned to every significant customer, supplier and lender for ease of reference in accounting records of the financial institution.

Refers to the unique code of the accounting standard or the rules to which accountants adhere when preparing financial statements to ensure minimum level of consistency. E.g. GAAP, IFRS etc. Generally Accepted Accounting Principles, GAAP. GAAP are the rules to which accountants adhere when preparing financial statements to ensure minimum level of consistency. The Generally Accepted Accounting Principles exist to ensure that accountants are using the same or almost the same standards so that comparison of financial statements between or within a company is easy and accurate. They also promote transparency in accounting. However, GAAP provides broad guidelines, there is room for companies to follow an approach within a guideline.
Refers to the channel through which customer was acquired.
Refers to the date as on which the snapshot of source data extracted for processing.

Refers to the monthly Average balance. There are different ways to compute monthly average balance. A simple method would be, Opening balance Plus Closing Balance, divided by 2. A complex method would be find out for how many days the balance was with the Financial Institution and then compute the average balance.

attributes.logicalName: Average Balance Month To Date In Local Currency
attributes.gcd: Refers to the monthly average balance in local currency. There are different ways to compute monthly average balance. A simple method would be, Opening balance Plus Closing Balance, divided by 2. A complex method would be find out for how many days the balance was with the Financial Institution and then compute the average balance.
Refers to the quarterly average balance.

attributes.logicalName: Average Balance Quarter To Date In Local Currency
attributes.gcd: Refers to the quarterly average balance in local currency.
Refers to the annual average balance.

attributes.logicalName: Average Balance Year To Date In Local Currency
attributes.gcd: Refers to the annual average balance in local currency.
Refers to the balance month to date.

attributes.logicalName: Balance Month To Date In Local Currency
attributes.gcd: Refers to the balance month to date in local currency.
Refers to the balance from the starting of quarter till date for the same financial year.

attributes.logicalName: Balance Quarter To Date In Local Currency
attributes.gcd: Refers to the balance from the starting of quarter till date for the same financial year in local currency.
Refers to the year to date balance is the time between the beginning of the fiscal year and the current day. The fiscal year may or may not match with the calendar year.

attributes.logicalName: Balance Year To Date In Local Currency
attributes.gcd: Refers to the year to date balance in local currency is the time between the beginning of the fiscal year and the current day. The fiscal year may or may not match with the calendar year.

Refers to the branch code. A branch, banking center or financial center is a retail location where a financial institution offers a wide array of face to face and automated services to its customers. This column Refers to the unique branch code assigned by the financial institution. A branch may specialize to offer certain type of products to customers. Branch needs approval from the regulators.

Refers to the business unit code as defined by the organization. A business unit is generally a broader definition and represents all the units in an organization. Business Unit dimension is the equivalent dimension table for this column.
Refers to the code combinations received from accounting hub

Refers to counterparty code of the bank in the SFT transactions. The customer reference code represents the end customer of the repo transaction. This counterparty code references the counterparty to the bank, in the case of tri party SFT transactions. In the tri party SFT transactions, one party acts as the client, one party acts as the agent, and the other party acts as the dealer. This counterparty code will refer identified of the dealer.

Refers to the source system from where data is extracted. Data can be sourced from multiple sources, this column will Refers to the source code from where the data is extracted for this extraction date.
Refers to the effective date of the account or contract or interest rate or exchange rate from which it is effective.
Refers to the unique general ledger account code.

Refers to the general ledger type of the GL account code. Indicative values LOS Loss, GNS Gains, EXP Expense, REV Revenue, OWNEQ Owners Equity, LIAB Liability, AST Asset, ALL . General Ledger Account Dimension is the equivalent dimension of this attribute.

ISO currency codes is a standard published by the International Organization for Standardization 4217, which delineates currency designators and country codes, alpha and numeric. This column will capture the standardized currency code. Currency dimension is the equivalent dimension table for this column.
Refers to the unique identifier for designating related companies.
Refers to the ledger identifier.
Refers to the entity code of the legal entity to which the account will be attributed in the general ledger.

Refers to line of business, LOB, is a functional unit that offers the products to the customer by the financial entity. Example: Corporate Finance, Trade Services, Private Wealth Management, Treasury Services, Retail Banking, Cards services etc. Refers to the unique code of the line of business applicable to the respective product.
Refers to a unique ISO code representing a particular local currency.
Refers to the unique location code. Location code is defined as the code which will represent the address of the property from zip code onwards like which city, country etc.
Refers to the management ledger chart of accounts code combination identifier.
Refers to the cost center to which the account belongs to. Organization Unit dimension is the equivalent dimension table for this column.
Refers to the unique identifier for the party. Party is defined as an entity or a person who takes part or is involved in an agreement, lawsuit, or transaction.
Refers to the unique code assigned to each of the Products offered by the Bank.
Refers to the project code.
Refers to the record creation date. It has been added to all catalog entities to enable partitioning and archival.
Refers to the run identifier for a set of Records participating in the particular Run with the Run Execution identifier. This is a combination of Run Main Identifier and Run Execution Identifier.
Refers to the number used for versioning computed or processed data.
